intro: Zehnderia microgyna, commonly known as the small-fruited zehnderia, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when mature. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
